dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So Mark Zuckerberg's latest donation, another 250 million in Amazon stock to the Gates Foundation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Mark Zuckerberg's latest donation, another two hundred fifty million in Amazon stock to the Gates Foundation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity. CZI confirmed the $214 million donation but declined to comment further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that brings his total giving there to over two and a half billion dollars, all in Amazon shares. It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that brings his total giving there to over two and a half billion dollars, all in Amazon shares. It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's through their Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, CZI. They confirmed the amount but didn't want to say anything else about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's through their Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, C Z I. They confirmed the amount but didn't want to say anything else about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity. CZI confirmed the $214 million donation but declined to comment further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and this is happening while they've got a new CEO stepping in, Mark Carson, from Arizona State University Foundation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and this is happening while they've got a new C E O stepping in, Mark Carson, from Arizona State University Foundation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Starting January 2nd, right? He's got a background in student affairs and community engagement at Stanford too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Starting January second, right? He's got a background in student affairs and community engagement at Stanford too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She will begin her role in on December 19, according to the foundation. Before working at the Arizona State University Foundation, Taylor was associate vice provost of student affairs and dean of community engagement and diversity at Stanford University, and served as president and CEO of Menlo Park, Calif.-based Thrive Foundation for Youth, a nonprofit focused on developing youth ages 10 to 18.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and he mentioned something interesting—how Silicon Valley's innovation culture can sometimes hide deeper social issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and he mentioned something interesting-how Silicon Valley's innovation culture can sometimes hide deeper social issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, one in which deep social challenges are often masked by the high-profile innovation culture. There is important work to be done in partnership with our donors, our community organizations and our civic and business leaders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that contrast he pointed out is pretty telling. Meanwhile, the foundation itself has had its own issues, like with that previous CEO, Taylor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that contrast he pointed out is pretty telling. Meanwhile, the foundation itself has had its own issues, like with that previous C E O, Taylor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF, without specifying whether Carson resigned or was fired, or whether he was paid a severance or not. The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, the reports about the toxic workplace under his watch… the investigation was pretty damning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, the reports about the toxic workplace under his watch... the investigation was pretty damning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the investigation was completed in June, the foundation published the summary and said in a statement that many allegations from current and former employees were substantiated and that SVCF clearly failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace environment for its employees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they paid him 1.2 million a year while that was going on? That's tough to swallow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they paid him one point two million a year while that was going on? That's tough to swallow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carson, Forbes reported, was paid nearly $1 million a year, and was proud of the fact that under his watch, the foundations assets grew from less than $1 billion to $13.5 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The board did apologize though, said the behavior outlined never should have happened. But Taylor just praised his own achievements in his statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The board did apologize though, said the behavior outlined never should have happened. But Taylor just praised his own achievements in his statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The board also issued an apology in June: The unacceptable workplace behavior that took place at SVCF as outlined in the investigative report should never have happened and there is no excuse for it. Carson could not be reached for comment at the time, but he issued a statement in June that praising his achievements at SVCF and skirted responsibility for the harassing behavior on his watch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Classic deflection. And then Dustin Moskovitz—the number two exec—resigned a couple months before all that came out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Classic deflection. And then Dustin Moskovitz-the number two exec-resigned a couple months before all that came out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carsons departure came two months after the foundations former number two executive, Mari Ellen Loijens, the chief business, development and brand officer, resigned after the Chronicle of Philanthropy published an article detailing allegations of Loijens harassing behavior.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a lot of turnover for such a huge foundation. Eight billion in assets under management, second-largest in the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a lot of turnover for such a huge foundation. Eight billion in assets under management, second-largest in the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While SVCF grew quietly, as of early 2018 it had more than $13.5 billion in assets under management, making it the largest community foundation in the country as measured by assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And so much of that comes from these massive donations from tech billionaires. Zuckerberg, Hastings, even Moskovitz himself donated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And so much of that comes from these massive donations from tech billionaires. Zuckerberg, Hastings, even Moskovitz himself donated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes published an investigation in May detailing Carsons management style, the foundations high turnover rate and complaints about management by former employees as well as details about donations from tech powerhouses to the foundation, including a donation of $1.75 billion in Facebook shares by Zuckerberg and gifts from the WhatsApp founders,Netflix NFLX CEO Reed Hastings and Facebook cofounder Dustin Moskovitz and his wife Cari Tuna.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Using those restricted funds too, which are like venture accounts for philanthropy. Super convenient for tax purposes, especially after big liquidity events.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Using those restricted funds too, which are like venture accounts for philanthropy. Super convenient for tax purposes, especially after big liquidity events.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most people donate to SVCF using something called a donor-advised fund, which is like a charitable bank account that holds assets until the donor wants to disperse some or all of the money to a nonprofit. Donors can deduct as much as 30% of adjusted gross income when contributing to a donor-advised fund, so they are particularly attractive in years when theres a big tax bill after, say, selling your company or selling shares in an IPO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Donors can deduct up to 20% of their adjusted gross income that way. Smart move financially, but you wonder about the oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Donors can deduct up to twenty percent of their adjusted gross income that way. Smart move financially, but you wonder about the oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Donors can deduct as much as 30% of adjusted gross income when contributing to a donor-advised fund, so they are particularly attractive in years when theres a big tax bill after, say, selling your company or selling shares in an IPO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Hopefully this new leadership can steer things in a better direction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Hopefully this new leadership can steer things in a better direction.

HostA: Classic deflection. And then Dustin Moskovitz—the number two exec—resigned a couple months before all that came out.
